title: Standard Form of Hyperbola with Center (0,0)
text: The standard form of the equation of a hyperbola with center (0,0) and transverse axis on the x-axis is $$\frac{x^2}{a^2}-\frac{y^2}{b^2}=1$$ where the length of the transverse axis is 2a the coordinates of the vertices are (a,0),(-a,0) the length of the conjugate axis is 2b the coordinates of the co-vertices are (0,b),(0,b) the distance between the foci is 2c, where $$c^2=a^2+b^2$$ the coordinates of the foci are (c,0),(-c,0) the equations of the asymptotes are $$y=\frac{b}{a} x$$, $$y=-\left(\frac{b}{a}\right) x$$ (See the left image) The standard form of the equation of a hyperbola with center (0,0) and transverse axis on the y-axis is $$\frac{y^2}{a^2}-\frac{x^2}{b^2}=1$$ where the length of the transverse axis is 2a the coordinates of the vertices are (0,a),(0,-a) the length of the conjugate axis is 2b the coordinates of the co-vertices are (b,0),(-b,0) the distance between the foci is 2c, where $$c^2=a^2+b^2$$ the coordinates of the foci are (0,c),(0,-c) the equations of the asymptotes are y=(a/b)*x,y=-(a/b)*x (See the right image)\n##figure1.gif##
